page.title: 02HOUSING IN ST TEATH
page.content: THE HOUSES IN THE AREA ARE VARIED IN TYPE AND AGE. GENERALLY THEY TEND TO BE OLDER DETACHED, OR TERRACED HOUSES OR MODERN BUNGALOWS. THE MOST COMMON BUILDING MATERIALS ARE STONE (MAINLY SLATE) FOR OLDER DWELLINGS AND CONCRETE BLOCKS FOR THE NEWER BUILDINGS. ROOFS ARE MAINLY DELABOLE SLATE EXCEPT FOR THE NEWEST BUILDINGS. THERE ARE A LARGE NUMBER OF HOMES WHICH ARE OVER 100 YEARS OLD AND MANY BUILT IN THE LAST 20 YEARS. THE{AVERAGE}TIME PEOPLE STAY IN THEIR HOME IS 11 YEARS. NEARLY HALF THE HOMES ARE {WITHOUT} GARAGES. THE VILLAGE OF ST TEATH IS THE ONLY REAL RESIDENTIAL CENTRE IN THE WHOLE AREA. THERE ARE 2 ADJACENT NEW ESTATES AND A RESIDENTIAL CARAVAN PARK. BUILDING CONTINUES.
